content: There are no paragraphs provided in the prev_chunk, so the summarized curr_chunk is: "AMENDMENTS TO IMPACT AID PROGRAM." "AMENDMENTS TO IMPACT AID PROGRAM. Payments related to federal acquisition of real property and for eligible federally connected children are amended to ensure entitlement rather than eligibility, with certain subsections being removed and computations adjusted." The Impact Aid program is amended to ensure entitlement rather than eligibility for payments related to federal acquisition of real property and for eligible federally connected children. Subsections are removed and computations adjusted. The Impact Aid program is amended to ensure entitlement for payments related to federal acquisition of real property and for federally connected children. Subsections are removed and computations adjusted, including changes to wording regarding maximum amounts and eligibility. The Impact Aid program is amended to ensure entitlement for payments related to federal acquisition of real property and for federally connected children. Changes include replacing "eligible" with "entitled" in various clauses and headings. The amendment replaces "eligible" with "entitled" in various clauses and headings related to the Impact Aid program. The amendment replaces "eligible" with "entitled" in clauses and headings related to the Impact Aid program. The amendment modifies clauses and headings in the Impact Aid program by replacing "eligible" with "entitled" and adjusting language regarding entitlement status. The amendment adjusts language in the Impact Aid program, replacing "eligible" with "entitled" and modifying clauses and headings related to entitlement status. The amendment modifies language in the Impact Aid program, changing "eligible" to "entitled" and adjusting clauses and headings related to entitlement status. It includes changes to paragraphs (3) and (4) regarding maximum amounts and threshold payments. The amendment to the Impact Aid program modifies language related to entitlement status and payment thresholds for children with disabilities under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act. The amendment to the Impact Aid program adjusts funding criteria based on per-pupil expenditure in public schools and grants received under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act. It also includes a hold harmless provision for local educational agencies for fiscal year 2004. The amendment to the Impact Aid program sets limits on funding for local educational agencies for fiscal years 2004 and 2005. It also makes changes to policies and procedures for children residing on Indian lands and updates the application process for payments under the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to change "eligibility" to "entitlement" in section 8005(b)(1). Section 8007 is also amended to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2004 through 2006. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2004 through 2006 in various sections. Section 8014 is repealed, and a rule of construction is added to Title VIII. Section 8014 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is repealed, and a rule of construction is added to Title VIII stating that no individual is entitled to assistance under any program funded under this title. The amendments made by this Act will take effect on October 1, 2003, or the date of enactment, whichever is later.
